meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

abstract.p: Photo of New York City Marathon runners picking up their race numbers at Jacob K Javits Convention Center

block.p: On Your Mark, Wait! Thousands of runners for the New York City Marathon inched into the Jacob K. Javits Convention Center yesterday to pick up their race numbers and a variety of extras at the annual runners fitness expo. About 36,000 athletes are expected to start the race tomorrow at the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge.
SPORTSSATURDAY, PAGE D2

Palestinians Seek Unity As Arafat Seems to Fade With Yasir Arafat apparently near death, leading Palestinian politicians have moved to prevent a visible power vacuum, reaching out to disaffected younger legislators, Palestinian militant organizations and, quietly, the Israelis. But it is unlikely that any new, more collective leadership will be able to make important decisions for some time.
PAGE A3

Russia Ratifies Warming Pact Vladimir V. Putin signed Russia's ratification of the Kyoto Protocol on global warming, clearing the way for the treaty, aimed at reducing emissions of heat-trapping gases, to take effect early next year.
PAGE A7

Chile's Army Accepts Blame Reversing course, the Chilean Army acknowledged that it must bear ''institutional'' blame for human rights violations that occurred in Chile under the dictatorship of Gen. Augusto Pinochet.
PAGE A5
Manager Is Out After 4 Days Wally Backman's first managing job in the majors ended abruptly when the Arizona Diamondbacks fired him after he failed to disclose legal indiscretions.
SPORTSSATURDAY, PAGE D1
F.D.A. Seeking Advice The Food and Drug Administration announced it would hire the government's top scientific review agency to figure out whether its drug-safety system is adequate.
PAGE A11

About 36,000 athletes are expected to start the race tomorrow at the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge.
